Class GooseExecutorImpl

java.lang.Object
org.tanzu.goose.cf.GooseExecutorImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
GooseExecutor
public class GooseExecutorImpl extends Object implements GooseExecutor
Default implementation of GooseExecutor.

This implementation uses ProcessBuilder to invoke the Goose CLI and follows best practices for process management in Cloud Foundry environments.

Critical Implementation Details

This implementation follows patterns to avoid common ProcessBuilder pitfalls:

  • Always closes stdin immediately to prevent CLI from waiting for input
  • Redirects stderr to stdout to prevent buffer deadlock
  • Passes environment variables to subprocess explicitly
  • Uses timeouts to prevent indefinite hangs
  • Properly cleans up resources

Environment Variables

Required environment variables:

  • GOOSE_CLI_PATH - Path to the Goose CLI executable
  • One of: ANTHROPIC_API_KEY, OPENAI_API_KEY, GOOGLE_API_KEY, etc.
  • HOME - Home directory (for Goose configuration)
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
Goose Buildpack Team

  • Constructor Details

    • GooseExecutorImpl

      public GooseExecutorImpl()
      Constructs a new executor using environment variables.

      Requires the following environment variables to be set:

      • GOOSE_CLI_PATH
      • At least one LLM provider API key
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if required environment variables are not set

    • GooseExecutorImpl

      public GooseExecutorImpl(String goosePath, Map<String,String> apiKeys)
      Constructs a new executor with explicit configuration.
      Parameters:
      goosePath - path to the Goose CLI executable
      apiKeys - map of provider API keys (e.g., ANTHROPIC_API_KEY -> value)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if goosePath is null or empty

    • execute

      public String execute(String prompt)
      Description copied from interface: GooseExecutor
      Execute a Goose command synchronously.

      This method blocks until the Goose CLI command completes and returns the full output as a single string.

      Specified by:
      execute in interface GooseExecutor
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt to send to Goose
      Returns:
      the complete output from Goose

    • executeAsync

      public CompletableFuture<String> executeAsync(String prompt)
      Description copied from interface: GooseExecutor
      Execute a Goose command asynchronously.

      This method returns immediately with a CompletableFuture that will be completed when the Goose command finishes. The future can be used to attach callbacks or wait for completion at a later time.

      Specified by:
      executeAsync in interface GooseExecutor
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt to send to Goose
      Returns:
      a CompletableFuture that completes with the command output

    • executeStreaming

      public Stream<String> executeStreaming(String prompt)
      Description copied from interface: GooseExecutor
      Execute a Goose command and return output as a stream of lines.

      This method returns a Stream that emits each line of output as it becomes available from the Goose CLI process. This enables true real-time streaming where lines are processed as they are produced, not after the command completes.

      CRITICAL - Resource Management: The returned Stream manages an active subprocess and must be closed to prevent resource leaks. Always use try-with-resources or explicitly call close() on the Stream: 

      // Recommended: try-with-resources
try (Stream<String> lines = executor.executeStreaming("analyze code")) {
    lines.forEach(System.out::println);
}
      Specified by:
      executeStreaming in interface GooseExecutor
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt to send to Goose
      Returns:
      a Stream of output lines that must be closed when done

    • isAvailable

      public boolean isAvailable()
      Description copied from interface: GooseExecutor
      Check if Goose CLI is available and properly configured.

      This method performs basic health checks:

      • Verifies GOOSE_CLI_PATH environment variable is set
      • Verifies the CLI executable exists
      • Verifies at least one LLM provider API key is set
      Specified by:
      isAvailable in interface GooseExecutor
      Returns:
      true if Goose CLI is available, false otherwise

    • executeInSession

      public String executeInSession(String sessionName, String prompt, boolean resume)
      Description copied from interface: GooseExecutor
      Execute a Goose command within a named session.

      Named sessions allow multi-turn conversations where Goose maintains context across multiple invocations. Sessions are stored in Goose's SQLite database at ~/.local/share/goose/sessions/sessions.db.

      For new sessions, this starts a session with the given name. For existing sessions, use GooseExecutor.executeInSession(String, String, boolean, GooseOptions) with resume=true to continue the conversation.

      Specified by:
      executeInSession in interface GooseExecutor
      Parameters:
      sessionName - the name for this session (e.g., "chat-session-abc123")
      prompt - the prompt to send to Goose
      resume - if true, resumes an existing session; if false, starts new
      Returns:
      the complete output from Goose

    • executeInSession
